definition: woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Droughts and forest fires are expected to increase due to climate change.
sentences.chinese: 由於氣候變化，預計將會出現更多的乾旱和林火。

sentences.english: Unless you want to start a forest fire, you better put out that fire.
sentences.chinese: 除非你想發動一場林火，你最好把那火滅了。

sentences.english: It is the space-time risk model of forest fire to synthesize both.
sentences.chinese: 將二者綜合即爲林火的時空風險模型。

sentences.english: The 2009 Black Saturday bushfires decimated the state of Victoria.
sentences.chinese: 2009年黑色星期六林火毀滅的維多利亞州。

sentences.english: Fires occur on an annual basis in the Khabarovsk and Primorky areas.
sentences.chinese: 哈巴羅夫斯克和普里摩斯基地區每年都要發生林火。

sentences.english: The spatial variance of drought index directly affects the spatial pattern of burning rates.
sentences.chinese: 乾燥度的空間差異對林火燃燒率格局有正向影響。

definition: wildfire/(spreading like) wildfire/bush fire/farm fire (for clearing fields)
to clear waste land or forest by burning/slash-and-burn (agriculture)
